lines.text: Enter, with drum and colours, MARCIUS, TITUS  LARTIUS, Captains and Soldiers. To them a Messenger

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: Yonder comes news. A wager they have met.

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: My horse to yours, no.

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: Tis done.

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: Agreed.

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: Say, has our general met the enemy

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: They lie in view but have not spoke as yet.

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: So, the good horse is mine.

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: Ill buy him of you.

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: No, Ill nor sell nor give him: lend you him I will For half a hundred years. Summon the town.

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: How far off lie these armies

lines.speaker: messenger
lines.text: Within this mile and half.

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: Then shall we hear their larum, and they ours. Now, Mars, I prithee, make us quick in work, That we with smoking swords may march from hence, To help our fielded friends! Come, blow thy blast. Tutus Aufidius, is he within your walls
They sound a parley. Enter two Senators with others on the walls

lines.speaker: first senator
lines.text: No, nor a man that fears you less than he, Thats lesser than a little. Hark! our drums Are bringing forth our youth. Well break our walls, Rather than they shall pound us up: our gates, Which yet seem shut, we, have but pinnd with rushes Theyll open of themselves. Hark you. far off! There is Aufidius list, what work he makes Amongst your cloven army.
Drums afar off
Alarum afar off

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: O, they are at it!

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: Their noise be our instruction. Ladders, ho!
Enter the army of the Volsces

lines.speaker: marcius
lines.text: They fear us not, but issue forth their city. Now put your shields before your hearts, and fight With hearts more proof than shields. Advance, brave Titus: They do disdain us much beyond our thoughts, Which makes me sweat with wrath. Come on, my fellows: He that retires Ill take him for a Volsce, And he shall feel mine edge. All the contagion of the south light on you, You shames of Rome! you herd ofBoils and plagues Plaster you oer, that you may be abhorrd Further than seen and one infect another Against the wind a mile! You souls of geese, That bear the shapes of men, how have you run From slaves that apes would beat! Pluto and hell! All hurt behind backs red, and faces pale With flight and agued fear! Mend and charge home, Or, by the fires of heaven, Ill leave the foe And make my wars on you: look tot: come on If youll stand fast, well beat them to their wives, As they us to our trenches followed. So, now the gates are ope: now prove good seconds: Tis for the followers fortune widens them, Not for the fliers: mark me, and do the like.
Alarum. The Romans are beat back to their trenches. Reenter MARCIUS cursing
Another alarum. The Volsces fly, and MARCIUS follows them to the gates
Enters the gates

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: Foolhardiness not I.

lines.speaker: second soldier
lines.text: Nor I.
MARCIUS is shut in

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: See, they have shut him in.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: To the pot, I warrant him.
Alarum continues
Reenter TITUS LARTIUS

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: What is become of Marcius

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Slain, sir, doubtless.

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: Following the fliers at the very heels, With them he enters who, upon the sudden, Clappd to their gates: he is himself alone, To answer all the city.

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: O noble fellow! Who sensibly outdares his senseless sword, And, when it bows, stands up. Thou art left, Marcius: A carbuncle entire, as big as thou art, Were not so rich a jewel. Thou wast a soldier Even to Catos wish, not fierce and terrible Only in strokes but, with thy grim looks and The thunderlike percussion of thy sounds, Thou madst thine enemies shake, as if the world Were feverous and did tremble.
Reenter MARCIUS, bleeding, assaulted by the enemy

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: Look, sir.

lines.speaker: lartius
lines.text: O,tis Marcius! Lets fetch him off, or make remain alike.
They fight, and all enter the city
